cards.name: Acrobatic Maneuver
cards.text:
Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Renegades find ever more creative ways to work around the Consulate's aether regulations.

cards.name: Aerial Responder
cards.text: Flying, vigilance, lifelink
cards.flavor: Dwarves have an instinct for repair, an inherent understanding of how systems work, and a reputation for fearlessness. They're perfect candidates for the Fair's emergency response team.

cards.name: Aetherstorm Roc
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Aetherstorm Roc or another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Whenever Aetherstorm Roc attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it and tap up to one target creature defending player controls.

cards.name: Angel of Invention
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, lifelink
Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
Other creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Authority of the Consuls
cards.text:
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Citizens are free to do as they wish, within the confines of the Consulate's laws.

cards.name: Aviary Mechanic
cards.text: When Aviary Mechanic enters the battlefield, you may return another permanent you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Pilots take crippled skyships to the Aviaries, trusting Ghirapur's most talented mechanics to get them back into the air.

cards.name: Built to Last
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's an artifact creature, it gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Consulate-built automatons have a lifetime warranty.

cards.name: Captured by the Consulate
cards.text:
Enchant creature you don't control
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, if it has a single target, change the target to enchanted creature if able.
cards.flavor:
"At last, the infamous Pia Nalaar."
-Tezzeret

cards.name: Cataclysmic Gearhulk
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Cataclysmic Gearhulk enters the battlefield, each player chooses an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a planeswalker from among the nonland permanents they control, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.name: Consulate Surveillance
cards.text:
When Consulate Surveillance enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by a source of your choice.

cards.name: Consul's Shieldguard
cards.text:
When Consul's Shieldguard enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Consul's Shieldguard attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, another target attacking creature gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.name: Eddytrail Hawk
cards.text:
Flying
When Eddytrail Hawk enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Eddytrail Hawk attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, another target attacking creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Fairgrounds Warden
cards.text: When Fairgrounds Warden enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until Fairgrounds Warden leaves the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "You're coming with me."

cards.name: Fragmentize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment with mana value 4 or less.
cards.flavor:
"Too much friction on your bearings, your countersinking is inconsistent, and there are lines in your casting. Dispose of it, and begin again."
-Dovin Baan

cards.name: Fumigate
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. You gain 1 life for each creature destroyed this way.
cards.flavor:
"Ghirapur's gremlin population poses a threat to the infrastructure of the fairgrounds. Threats must be eliminated."
-Sram, senior edificer

cards.name: Gearshift Ace
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Gearshift Ace crews a Vehicle, that Vehicle gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Some display their trophies at the Hall of Mechanists. Others display their talent in the streets of Ghirapur.

foreignPrintings.name: As de la boîte de vitesse

cards.name: Glint-Sleeve Artisan
cards.text: Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
cards.flavor: "Shine bright, bolts tight."

cards.name: Herald of the Fair
cards.text: When Herald of the Fair enters the battlefield, target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Welcome, one and all! Right this way! Open your eyes, your ears, and your imaginations to the wonders of the Inventors' Fair!"

cards.name: Impeccable Timing
cards.text: Impeccable Timing deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: When Baral constructed his trap for Chandra, he did not account for the arrival of an enormous leonin wielding a twin-headed axe.

cards.name: Inspired Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: One dwarf on a build team ensures competence. All dwarves on the team ensures brilliance.

cards.name: Master Trinketeer
cards.text:
Servos and Thopters you control get +1/+1.
{3}{W}: Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
cards.flavor: "Let us never forget the joy that lies at the heart of invention."

cards.name: Ninth Bridge Patrol
cards.text: Whenever another creature you control leaves the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Ninth Bridge Patrol.
cards.flavor: The Consulate keeps watch at each of the eleven bridges to ensure that the market remains a haven for commerce, not for con artists.

cards.name: Pressure Point
cards.text:
Tap target creature.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Everything has an off switch.

cards.name: Propeller Pioneer
cards.text:
Flying
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
cards.flavor: "The sky isn't the limit. It's the starting point."

cards.name: Refurbish
cards.text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"There's no reason to buy a new one when I've got the tools to fix the one you've got."
-Ripu, repair specialist

cards.name: Revoke Privileges
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack, block, or crew Vehicles.
cards.flavor: "By order of Consulate Mandate 482, I am required to detain you, citizen."

cards.name: Servo Exhibition
cards.text: Create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.
cards.flavor:
"The judges really put them through their paces, but they prevailed. I think they even impressed Head Judge Tezzeret."
-Ritika, artificer

cards.name: Skyswirl Harrier
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The great birds dive through the sky, wings skimming the aether streams, to fall upon their unsuspecting prey.

cards.name: Skywhaler's Shot
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 3 or greater. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.flavor: In the moment of truth, it is as though time stands still, and the whale waits, suspended in the sky.

cards.name: Tasseled Dromedary
cards.flavor: There is no dress code for the Inventors' Fair, but you'll be hard-pressed to find anyone or anything not done up in their finest.

cards.name: Thriving Ibex
cards.text:
When Thriving Ibex enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Ibex attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Textiles at the Inventors' Fair feature threads from every corner of Kaladesh.

foreignPrintings.name: 亢進するアイベックス

cards.name: Toolcraft Exemplar
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control an artifact, Toolcraft Exemplar gets +2/+1 until end of turn. If you control three or more artifacts, it also gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "If you wish to produce the finest work, you must start with the finest tools."

cards.name: Trusty Companion
cards.text:
Vigilance
Trusty Companion can't attack alone.
cards.flavor: It shows affection an automaton never could.

cards.name: Visionary Augmenter
cards.text: Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
cards.flavor: "It's a multifunctional radial extension system with superlateral, force-amplifying rigging. Of course it will win."

cards.name: Wispweaver Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Wispweaver Angel enters the battlefield, you may exile another target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Aether Meltdown
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature or Vehicle
When Aether Meltdown enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Enchanted creature gets -4/-0.

cards.name: Aether Theorist
cards.text:
When Aether Theorist enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Aether Tradewinds
cards.text: Return target permanent you control and target permanent you don't control to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: Consulate engineers have developed safe methods of harvesting aether, but renegades aren't always so careful.

cards.name: Aethersquall Ancient
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}: Return all other creatures to their owners' hands. Activate only as a sorcery.

cards.name: Ceremonious Rejection
cards.text: Counter target colorless spell.
cards.flavor: The judges at the Fair are held in such high esteem that a nod of recognition can inspire an inventor for a lifetime-and a wave of dismissal can end a career.

cards.name: Confiscation Coup
cards.text: Choose target artifact or creature. You get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters), then you may pay an amount of {E} equal to that permanent's mana value. If you do, gain control of it.
cards.flavor: "Citizens, do not resist. This is for your safety. Tezzeret bids you to surrender your inventions. Now."

cards.name: Curio Vendor
cards.flavor: "Step right up! Try your hand! It'll thrill the senses and boggle the mind!"

cards.name: Disappearing Act
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.
Counter target spell.
cards.flavor:
"Baral took my family from me back then. I'd do anything to face him now."
-Chandra Nalaar

cards.name: Dramatic Reversal
cards.text: Untap all nonland permanents you control.
cards.flavor:
"Nobody asked you to butt in, Jace. But thanks."
-Chandra Nalaar

cards.name: Era of Innovation
cards.text:
Whenever an artifact or Artificer enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}, Sacrifice Era of Innovation: Draw three cards.

cards.name: Experimental Aviator
cards.text:
Flying
When Experimental Aviator enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.
cards.flavor: "The little thopters seemed lonely up here, so I thought I'd join them."

cards.name: Failed Inspection
cards.text: Counter target spell. Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: The most dangerous thing an artificer can do is believe an invention is perfect.

cards.name: Gearseeker Serpent
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.
{5}{U}: Gearseeker Serpent can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: Its collection is vast, yet each ship has a special place in its heart.

cards.name: Glimmer of Genius
cards.text: Scry 2, then draw two cards. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
cards.flavor: Creators live for that moment of inspiration: precious, profound, perfect.

cards.name: Glint-Nest Crane
cards.text:
Flying
When Glint-Nest Crane enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Hightide Hermit
cards.text:
Defender
When Hightide Hermit enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Hightide Hermit can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.

cards.name: Insidious Will
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Counter target spell.
• You may choose new targets for target spell.
• Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor:
"We meet again, pyromancer."
-Baral, Chief of Compliance

cards.name: Janjeet Sentry
cards.text:
When Janjeet Sentry enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}: You may tap or untap target artifact or creature.
cards.flavor: Janjeet Observatory is open to the public, but access to the adjoining laboratories is restricted.

cards.name: Long-Finned Skywhale
cards.text:
Flying
Long-Finned Skywhale can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: The aethersphere is home to the most wondrous beings on all of Kaladesh, although the dangers of traversing it mean that not much is known of them.

cards.name: Malfunction
cards.text:
Enchant artifact or creature
When Malfunction enters the battlefield, tap enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor: "They don't make them like they used to."

cards.name: Metallurgic Summonings
cards.text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, create an X/X colorless Construct artifact creature token, where X is that spell's mana value.
{3}{U}{U}, Exile Metallurgic Summonings: Return all instant and sorcery cards from your graveyard to your hand. Activate only if you control six or more artifacts.

cards.name: Minister of Inquiries
cards.text:
When Minister of Inquiries enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}: Target player mills three cards.
cards.flavor: "This research violates Consulate law."

cards.name: Nimble Innovator
cards.text: When Nimble Innovator enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "A failure is simply another opportunity for improvement. Just wait until you see what I come up with next."

cards.name: Padeem, Consul of Innovation
cards.text:
Artifacts you control have hexproof.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control the artifact with the highest mana value or tied for the highest mana value, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Impress me."

foreignPrintings.name: 発明の領事、パディーム

cards.name: Paradoxical Outcome
cards.text: Return any number of target nonland, nontoken permanents you control to their owners' hands. Draw a card for each card returned to your hand this way.
cards.flavor: The results of Rashmi's experimentation forced her to consider the possibility that multitudinous realities existed beyond her own.

cards.name: Revolutionary Rebuff
cards.text: Counter target nonartifact spell unless its controller pays {2}.
cards.flavor: By the time a Consulate sanction becomes official, the renegade quicksmiths have already found a way to circumvent it.

cards.name: Saheeli's Artistry
cards.text:
Choose one or both -
• Create a token that's a copy of target artifact.
• Create a token that's a copy of target creature, except it's an artifact in addition to its other types.
cards.flavor: "From the first touch, I know exactly what the metal wants to be."

cards.name: Select for Inspection
cards.text: Return target tapped creature to its owner's hand. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Shrewd Negotiation
cards.text: Exchange control of target artifact you control and target artifact or creature you don't control.
cards.flavor: "Pleasure doing business with you."

cards.name: Tezzeret's Ambition
cards.text: Draw three cards. If you control no artifacts, discard a card.
cards.flavor: "To achieve what none have achieved before, one must dare what none have dared before."

cards.name: Thriving Turtle
cards.text:
When Thriving Turtle enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Turtle attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Aether shapes everything on Kaladesh, from the sky to the sea.

cards.name: Torrential Gearhulk
cards.text:
Flash
When Torrential Gearhulk enters the battlefield, you may cast target instant card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that spell would be put into your graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Vedalken Blademaster
cards.text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: Vedalken have six thin, agile fingers on each hand, giving them unparalleled dexterity.

foreignPrintings.name: ヴィダルケンの刃の達人

cards.name: Weldfast Wingsmith
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Weldfast Wingsmith gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Airships are too confining. If I'm in the sky, I want to feel the wind in my hair and taste the aether."

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Drakes prowl the skies of Kaladesh, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.

cards.name: Aetherborn Marauder
cards.text:
Flying, lifelink
When Aetherborn Marauder enters the battlefield, move any number of +1/+1 counters from other permanents you control onto Aetherborn Marauder.
cards.flavor: "I don't know what that is or who it belongs to, but it's shiny and I want it."

cards.name: Ambitious Aetherborn
cards.text: Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
cards.flavor: Aetherborn who are unwilling to accept the decomposition of their bodies invent ways to preserve and augment themselves.

cards.name: Demon of Dark Schemes
cards.text:
Flying
When Demon of Dark Schemes enters the battlefield, all other creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Whenever another creature dies, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{2}{B}, Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control tapped.

cards.name: Dhund Operative
cards.text: As long as you control an artifact, Dhund Operative gets +1/+0 and has deathtouch.
cards.flavor: Baral's spies always have the latest technology.

cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor:
"Show them. Show them how hot your fire can burn."
-Liliana Vess, to Chandra Nalaar

cards.name: Die Young
cards.text: Choose target creature. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters), then you may pay any amount of {E}. The creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each {E} paid this way.
cards.flavor: "When the time comes, let go. Nothing lasts forever."

cards.name: Dukhara Scavenger
cards.text: When Dukhara Scavenger enters the battlefield, you may put target artifact or creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor: The teeth marks add character.

foreignPrintings.name: ダッカラのゴミあさり

cards.name: Eliminate the Competition
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice X creatures.
Destroy X target creatures.
cards.flavor: Open hostilities are strictly forbidden at the Inventors' Fair, but "accidents" still happen.

cards.name: Embraal Bruiser
cards.text:
Embraal Bruiser enters the battlefield tapped.
Embraal Bruiser has menace as long as you control an artifact.
cards.flavor: In Embraal, inventor gangs defend their turf with ingenious devices and blunt objects.

foreignPrintings.name: エンブロールの暴れ者

cards.name: Essence Extraction
cards.text: Essence Extraction deals 3 damage to target creature and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: The "gifted" among the aetherborn can draw the life essence of other living beings into themselves.

cards.name: Fortuitous Find
cards.text:
Choose one or both -
• Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: An aetherborn wastes neither time nor treasure.

cards.name: Foundry Screecher
cards.text:
Flying
Foundry Screecher gets +1/+0 as long as you control an artifact.
cards.flavor:
"My creations still can't match the dive speed of those floppy-winged mammals. Maybe I should enter one of them in the Fair."
-Viprikti, thopterist

cards.name: Fretwork Colony
cards.text:
Fretwork Colony can't block.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Fretwork Colony and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: The swarm leaves behind a flawless pattern that only occasionally threatens the structural integrity of the wood.

cards.name: Gonti, Lord of Luxury
cards.text:
Deathtouch
When Gonti, Lord of Luxury enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of target opponent's library, exile one of them face down, then put the rest on the bottom of that library in a random order. You may look at and cast that card for as long as it remains exiled, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any type to cast that spell.

cards.name: Harsh Scrutiny
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card. Scry 1.
cards.flavor:
"If you've done nothing wrong, you have nothing to fear."
-Enforcer-Chief Ranaj

cards.name: Lawless Broker
cards.text: When Lawless Broker dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
cards.flavor: Kaladesh's illicit marketplaces are known as "night markets," but if you know who to ask, you can find what you're looking for at any time of the day.

cards.name: Live Fast
cards.text: You draw two cards, lose 2 life, and get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
cards.flavor: "When you have the chance, take it. Laugh, sing, dance. Don't allow the night to end."

cards.name: Lost Legacy
cards.text: Choose a nonartifact, nonland card name. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. That player shuffles, then draws a card for each card exiled from their hand this way.
cards.flavor:
"That name shall not be spoken."
-Baral, Chief of Compliance

cards.name: Make Obsolete
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Yesterday's marvels are today's antiques.

cards.name: Marionette Master
cards.text:
Fabricate 3 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put three +1/+1 counters on it or create three 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target opponent loses life equal to Marionette Master's power.

cards.name: Maulfist Squad
cards.text:
Menace
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
cards.flavor: "Nice invention there. Looks real fragile."

cards.name: Midnight Oil
cards.text:
Midnight Oil enters the battlefield with seven hour counters on it.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card and remove two hour counters from Midnight Oil.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of hour counters on Midnight Oil.
Whenever you discard a card, you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: Many an inventor has collapsed under the pressure to create a flawless design.

cards.name: Morbid Curiosity
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Draw cards equal to the mana value of the sacrificed permanent.
cards.flavor: "Every creation carries a piece of its creators. Their knowledge, their dreams, their soul. That is the best part."

cards.name: Night Market Lookout
cards.text: Whenever Night Market Lookout becomes tapped, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: The Consulate rarely cracks the coded announcement of a night market's location before dawn, and enforcers are taken care of if they wander too close.

cards.name: Noxious Gearhulk
cards.text:
Menace
When Noxious Gearhulk enters the battlefield, you may destroy another target creature. If a creature is destroyed this way, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Ovalchase Daredevil
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Ovalchase Daredevil from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Let me guess. You thought I was dead."

cards.name: Prakhata Club Security
cards.flavor: It's rare that the Prakhata Club closes its doors. It's also rare that Lord Gonti meets with Consul Kambal. What are the odds the two would occur on the same day?

foreignPrintings.name: プラカタクラブの用心棒

cards.name: Rush of Vitality
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains lifelink and indestructible until end of turn. (Damage dealt by that creature also causes its controller to gain that much life, and it can't be destroyed by damage or effects that say "destroy.")
cards.flavor: Short lives lead to forbidden choices.

cards.name: Subtle Strike
cards.text:
Choose one or both -
• Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: Renegades do some of their best work right under the Consulate's nose.

cards.name: Syndicate Trafficker
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on Syndicate Trafficker. It gains indestructible until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The price isn't negotiable, but I'm sure you'll agree it's fair."

cards.name: Thriving Rats
cards.text:
When Thriving Rats enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Rats attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: In Ghirapur, even the lowliest residents live in lavish surroundings.

cards.name: Tidy Conclusion
cards.text: Destroy target creature. You gain 1 life for each artifact you control.
cards.flavor: Aetherborn patrons use any means necessary to secure victory for their protégés.

cards.name: Underhanded Designs
cards.text:
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice Underhanded Designs: Destroy target creature. Activate only if you control two or more artifacts.

cards.name: Weaponcraft Enthusiast
cards.text: Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
cards.flavor:
"No, I don't believe they have the proper permits for those, but I'm not going to be the one to ask."
-Caru, Consulate warden

foreignPrintings.name: Entusiasta de la forja de armas

cards.name: Aethertorch Renegade
cards.text:
When Aethertorch Renegade enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}: Aethertorch Renegade deals 1 damage to target creature.
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}: Aethertorch Renegade deals 6 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.name: Brazen Scourge
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor: Driven by an insatiable hunger, gremlins never cease feeding. They can destroy a lifetime of work in just a few moments.

cards.name: Built to Smash
cards.text: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. If it's an artifact creature, it gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Free from Consulate regulations, renegade-built automatons push performance to the limit.

cards.name: Cathartic Reunion
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard two cards.
Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: The chasm of years and worlds collapsed under the power of their embrace.

cards.name: Chandra, Torch of Defiance
cards.text:
[+1]: Exile the top card of your library. You may cast that card. If you don't, Chandra, Torch of Defiance deals 2 damage to each opponent.
[+1]: Add {R}{R}.
[−3]: Chandra, Torch of Defiance deals 4 damage to target creature.
[−7]: You get an emblem with "Whenever you cast a spell, this emblem deals 5 damage to any target."

foreignPrintings.name: 反逆の先導者、チャンドラ

cards.name: Chandra's Pyrohelix
cards.text: Chandra's Pyrohelix deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two targets.
cards.flavor: "This one's for my mom, and this one's for me."

cards.name: Combustible Gearhulk
cards.text:
First strike
When Combustible Gearhulk enters the battlefield, target opponent may have you draw three cards. If the player doesn't, you mill three cards, then Combustible Gearhulk deals damage to that player equal to the total mana value of those cards.

cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.
cards.flavor: Most came to Ghirapur for the Fair. Gremlins came for the feast.

cards.name: Fateful Showdown
cards.text: Fateful Showdown deals damage to any target equal to the number of cards in your hand. Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor: Tonight at the Grand Exhibition, witness Head Judge Tezzeret face off against the infamous renegade Pia Nalaar.

cards.name: Furious Reprisal
cards.text: Furious Reprisal deals 2 damage to each of two targets.
cards.flavor:
"Now that's the Chandra I've been waiting to see."
-Liliana Vess

cards.name: Giant Spectacle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace.
cards.flavor: The giant-decorating contest at the migration festival is a tradition that may have started as a dare.

cards.name: Harnessed Lightning
cards.text: Choose target creature. You get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters), then you may pay any amount of {E}. Harnessed Lightning deals that much damage to that creature.

cards.name: Hijack
cards.text: Gain control of target artifact or creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Whoa there. Easy. We're just going to take a little detour."

cards.name: Incendiary Sabotage
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Incendiary Sabotage deals 3 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor: "All of those Consulate safety measures undone with one simple tweak."

cards.name: Inventor's Apprentice
cards.text: Inventor's Apprentice gets +1/+1 as long as you control an artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Everyone starts off making garbage. If you finally make something halfway decent, it'll be the best day of your life."
-Nehra, inventor

cards.name: Lathnu Hellion
cards.text:
Haste
When Lathnu Hellion enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice Lathnu Hellion unless you pay {E}{E}.

cards.name: Madcap Experiment
cards.text: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal an artifact card. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. Madcap Experiment deals damage to you equal to the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Maulfist Doorbuster
cards.text:
When Maulfist Doorbuster enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Maulfist Doorbuster attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: "Knock, knock . . . too late."

cards.name: Pia Nalaar
cards.text:
When Pia Nalaar enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
{1}{R}: Target artifact creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{1}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Quicksmith Genius
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Quicksmiths are eager to jump from one project to the next, relying on flashes of inspiration rather than careful research.

cards.name: Reckless Fireweaver
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Reckless Fireweaver deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: Architects find inspiration in the dragon's beauty of form, while artificers are influenced by the function of its fire.

cards.name: Renegade Tactics
cards.text:
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Nothing against you. It's just that waiting for Consulate clearance was never really my thing."

cards.name: Ruinous Gremlin
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Ruinous Gremlin: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: City officials once sent twenty gleaming automatons to exterminate a nest of gremlins. They soon saw the error of their ways.

cards.name: Salivating Gremlins
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Salivating Gremlins gets +2/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If an elf can dream it, a dwarf can build it, and a gremlin can eat it.

cards.name: Skyship Stalker
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Skyship Stalker gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Skyship Stalker gains first strike until end of turn.
{R}: Skyship Stalker gains haste until end of turn.

foreignPrintings.name: 航空船に忍び寄るもの

cards.name: Spark of Creativity
cards.text: Choose target creature. Exile the top card of your library. You may have Spark of Creativity deal damage to that creature equal to the exiled card's mana value. If you don't, you may play that card until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"To invent is to rebel."
-Pia Nalaar

cards.name: Speedway Fanatic
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Speedway Fanatic crews a Vehicle, that Vehicle gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If her vehicle even has a brake, she couldn't tell you which pedal it is.

cards.name: Spireside Infiltrator
cards.text: Whenever Spireside Infiltrator becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: "The Consulate promised that we would all have access to aether. I'm just keeping them honest."

cards.name: Spontaneous Artist
cards.text:
When Spontaneous Artist enters the battlefield, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Pay {E}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Graffiti of the "leaking spire" symbol is found wherever the renegades have been.

cards.name: Start Your Engines
cards.text: Vehicles you control become artifact creatures until end of turn. Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Inventors from around the world have come to the Fair hoping their creations will fly, drive, or sail their way to a top prize.

cards.name: Territorial Gorger
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever you get one or more {E} (energy counters), Territorial Gorger gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Inventors have been known to capture gremlins with the intent to release them in a rival's workshop. More often than not, that plan backfires.

foreignPrintings.name: 縄張り持ちの大喰らい

cards.name: Terror of the Fairgrounds
cards.flavor:
"Consider this a high alert, people. Permission to destroy on sight. Either we take it down or it'll take down the Fair."
-Pav, gremlin watch

cards.name: Thriving Grubs
cards.text:
When Thriving Grubs enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Grubs attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Some passengers ride without tickets.

cards.name: Wayward Giant
cards.text: Menace
cards.flavor:
"The giants follow the flow of aether, and twice a year it leads them through here. Lesson learned. More clearance is needed."
-Sram, senior edificer

cards.name: Welding Sparks
cards.text: Welding Sparks deals X damage to target creature, where X is 3 plus the number of artifacts you control.
cards.flavor:
"The fires of invention burn in all of us. I fight for the freedom to unleash those flames."
-Pia Nalaar

cards.name: Appetite for the Unnatural
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"I'd just let the monkey have it if I were you. You can make another, but the same can't be said of your fingers."
-Turni, Greenwheel groundskeeper

cards.name: Arborback Stomper
cards.text:
Trample
When Arborback Stomper enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.
cards.flavor: The power of aether draws creatures to it like a magnetic force, and those that are touched by it are forever altered.

cards.name: Architect of the Untamed
cards.text:
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}: Create a 6/6 colorless Beast artifact creature token.
cards.flavor: Next to her designs, life seems like a pale imitation.

cards.name: Armorcraft Judge
cards.text: When Armorcraft Judge enters the battlefield, draw a card for each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Were she not a judge, she'd win the division herself.

cards.name: Attune with Aether
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
cards.flavor: "I've never seen a world where aether weaves through every aspect of nature."

cards.name: Blossoming Defense
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains hexproof until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Those who move harmoniously with the flow of aether can channel the power of the natural world.

cards.name: Bristling Hydra
cards.text:
When Bristling Hydra enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Bristling Hydra. It gains hexproof until end of turn.

cards.name: Commencement of Festivities
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to players this turn.
cards.flavor: Never before have there been so many brilliant minds and wondrous inventions in one place. Denizens from every corner of Kaladesh will flock to the once-in-a-lifetime Inventors' Fair.

cards.name: Cowl Prowler
cards.flavor: Consulate guards who pursue fleeing renegades into the Cowl often become lost-occasionally permanently-in the city's wildest greenbelt.

foreignPrintings.name: 僧帽地帯をうろつくもの

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor: Sanctions, mandates, regulations . . . These things mean nothing to the natural world.

cards.name: Cultivator of Blades
cards.text:
Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
Whenever Cultivator of Blades attacks, you may have other attacking creatures get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is Cultivator of Blades's power.

cards.name: Dubious Challenge
cards.text: Look at the top ten cards of your library, exile up to two creature cards from among them, then shuffle. Target opponent may choose one of the exiled cards and put it onto the battlefield under their control. Put the rest onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Durable Handicraft
cards.text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
{5}{G}, Sacrifice Durable Handicraft: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.name: Elegant Edgecrafters
cards.text:
Elegant Edgecrafters can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)

cards.name: Fairgrounds Trumpeter
cards.text: At the beginning of each end step, if a +1/+1 counter was put on a permanent under your control this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Fairgrounds Trumpeter.
cards.flavor: The louder the elephant trumpeted, the more the crowd cheered. And the more the crowd cheered . . .

foreignPrintings.name: Joueur de trompe de la foire

cards.name: Ghirapur Guide
cards.text: {2}{G}: Target creature you control can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less this turn.
cards.flavor: Fairgoers were delighted to find that even outside the fairgrounds, Ghirapur was a city of wonders.

cards.name: Highspire Artisan
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

cards.name: Hunt the Weak
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Then that creature fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor: Natural evolution is often at odds with industrial progress.

cards.name: Kujar Seedsculptor
cards.text: When Kujar Seedsculptor enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
cards.flavor: Every leaf, tree, and building in Kujar has been placed to achieve maximum harmony, in accordance with the elvish philosophy known as the Great Conduit.

foreignPrintings.name: クジャールの種子彫刻家

cards.name: Larger Than Life
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They say Head Judge Tezzeret will be reviewing every invention at the Fair. I made sure to build something that will stand out."
-Jehvani, Vahadar artificer

cards.name: Longtusk Cub
cards.text:
Whenever Longtusk Cub deals combat damage to a player, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Longtusk Cub.
cards.flavor: It won't be small forever.

foreignPrintings.name: Jeune tigre à défenses de sabre

cards.name: Nature's Way
cards.text: Target creature you control gains vigilance and trample until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.
cards.flavor: Many elves incorporate the beauty of nature into their inventions. Very few capture its savagery.

cards.name: Nissa, Vital Force
cards.text:
[+1]: Untap target land you control. Until your next turn, it becomes a 5/5 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.
[−3]: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.
[−6]: You get an emblem with "Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card."

cards.name: Ornamental Courage
cards.text: Untap target creature. It gets +1/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Inspired by the thorns and brambles of the untamed wilds, elvish armor is both beautiful and formidable.

cards.name: Oviya Pashiri, Sage Lifecrafter
cards.text:
{2}{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{4}{G}, {T}: Create an X/X colorless Construct artifact creature token, where X is the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor: "Inspiration is reciprocal: we all have a responsibility to each other to create."

foreignPrintings.name: Oviya Pashiri, sage façonneuse de vie
造命の賢者、オビア・パースリー
铸生智者奥薇亚帕西理
鑄生智者奧薇亞帕西理

cards.name: Peema Outrider
cards.text:
Trample
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
cards.flavor: Connected as artificer and invention, bonded as rider and steed.

cards.name: Riparian Tiger
cards.text:
Trample
When Riparian Tiger enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Riparian Tiger attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sage of Shaila's Claim
cards.text: When Sage of Shaila's Claim enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
cards.flavor: Even now, Shaila's descendants proudly occupy the greenway that she refused to relinquish to the Consulate.

foreignPrintings.name: Sabio de la Franja de Shaila
シャイラ専有地の賢者

cards.name: Servant of the Conduit
cards.text:
When Servant of the Conduit enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: "Creation without connection to nature is just manufacture."

cards.name: Take Down
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Take Down deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
• Take Down deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The drake flew true. The arrow flew truer.

cards.name: Thriving Rhino
cards.text:
When Thriving Rhino enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Rhino attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: As unpredictable as aether, and just as hard to contain.

cards.name: Verdurous Gearhulk
cards.text:
Trample
When Verdurous Gearhulk enters the battlefield, distribute four +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures you control.

cards.name: Wild Wanderer
cards.text: When Wild Wanderer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
cards.flavor: "We all began in nature, and nature is where we belong."

cards.name: Wildest Dreams
cards.text: Return X target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Wildest Dreams.
cards.flavor:
"I opened my mind to the immensity of the wonders around me. It was only then that I could see the Great Conduit."
-Rashmi, aether-seer

cards.name: Wily Bandar
cards.text: {2}{G}: Wily Bandar gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Part feline, part primate, all trouble.

cards.name: Cloudblazer
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloudblazer enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life and draw two cards.
cards.flavor: All the aether charts in the world can't compete with the trained eye of a talented scout.

cards.name: Contraband Kingpin
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, scry 1.
cards.flavor: "Don't waste my time with trifles. Bring me works of art, and I will make you rich."

cards.name: Depala, Pilot Exemplar
cards.text:
Other Dwarves you control get +1/+1.
Each Vehicle you control gets +1/+1 as long as it's a creature.
Whenever Depala, Pilot Exemplar becomes tapped, you may pay {X}. If you do, reveal the top X cards of your library, put all Dwarf and Vehicle cards from among them into your hand, then put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Dovin Baan
cards.text:
[+1]: Until your next turn, up to one target creature gets -3/-0 and its activated abilities can't be activated.
[−1]: You gain 2 life and draw a card.
[−7]: You get an emblem with "Your opponents can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps."

cards.name: Empyreal Voyager
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Whenever Empyreal Voyager deals combat damage to a player, you get that many {E} (energy counters).
cards.flavor: "For years, I studied the aethersphere from afar, but it was not until I touched the aether for myself that I came to know the power contained in the swirling sky."

cards.name: Engineered Might
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Hazardous Conditions
cards.text: Creatures with no counters on them get -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "There are many reasons we invent, of which survival is not the least."

cards.name: Kambal, Consul of Allocation
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, that player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: He has "friends" in places both high and low, and all seem to owe him favors.

foreignPrintings.name: 配分の領事、カンバール

cards.name: Rashmi, Eternities Crafter
cards.text: Whenever you cast your first spell each turn, reveal the top card of your library. You may cast it without paying its mana cost if it's a spell with lesser mana value. If you don't cast it, put it into your hand.

foreignPrintings.name: 永遠の造り手、ラシュミ

cards.name: Restoration Gearsmith
cards.text: When Restoration Gearsmith enters the battlefield, return target artifact or creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: All she touches turns to well-oiled, delicately calibrated, perfectly balanced gold.

cards.name: Saheeli Rai
cards.text:
[+1]: Scry 1. Saheeli Rai deals 1 damage to each opponent.
[−2]: Create a token that's a copy of target artifact or creature you control, except it's an artifact in addition to its other types. That token gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
[−7]: Search your library for up to three artifact cards with different names, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

cards.name: Unlicensed Disintegration
cards.text: Destroy target creature. If you control an artifact, Unlicensed Disintegration deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: "I'd stand back if I were you."

cards.name: Veteran Motorist
cards.text:
When Veteran Motorist enters the battlefield, scry 2.
Whenever Veteran Motorist crews a Vehicle, that Vehicle gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: He's set to compete in every race at the Fair, and he plans to win them all.

cards.name: Voltaic Brawler
cards.text:
When Voltaic Brawler enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Voltaic Brawler attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, it gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Whirler Virtuoso
cards.text:
When Whirler Virtuoso enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}: Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: The first tentative flaps are like a song to his soul.

cards.name: Accomplished Automaton
cards.text: Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
cards.flavor: Was it just lonely, or was some form of evolution inevitable?

cards.name: Aetherflux Reservoir
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 1 life for each spell you've cast this turn.
Pay 50 life: Aetherflux Reservoir deals 50 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: While most power is used for ordinary, everyday tasks, one shouldn't underestimate its potential for the extraordinary.

cards.name: Aetherworks Marvel
cards.text:
Whenever a permanent you control is put into a graveyard, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}: Look at the top six cards of your library. You may cast a spell from among them without paying its mana cost. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Animation Module
cards.text:
Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are put on a permanent you control, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{3}, {T}: Choose a counter on target permanent or player. Give that permanent or player another counter of that kind.
cards.flavor: Design leads to progress.

cards.name: Aradara Express
cards.text:
Menace
Crew 4 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 4 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: It glides around the city, a sublime combination of elegance and utility.

cards.name: Ballista Charger
cards.text:
Whenever Ballista Charger attacks, it deals 1 damage to any target.
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Bastion Mastodon
cards.text: {W}: Bastion Mastodon gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Consulate's automaton bank contains only the most impressive specimens.

cards.name: Bomat Bazaar Barge
cards.text:
When Bomat Bazaar Barge enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

foreignPrintings.name: ボーマットのバザール船

cards.name: Bomat Courier
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Bomat Courier attacks, exile the top card of your library face down. (You can't look at it.)
{R}, Discard your hand, Sacrifice Bomat Courier: Put all cards exiled with Bomat Courier into their owners' hands.

cards.name: Chief of the Foundry
cards.text: Other artifact creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: The foundries of Kaladesh run like clockwork under the supervision of their formidable overseers.

cards.name: Cogworker's Puzzleknot
cards.text:
When Cogworker's Puzzleknot enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{1}{W}, Sacrifice Cogworker's Puzzleknot: Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

cards.name: Consulate Skygate
cards.text:
Defender
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: All skyships entering or leaving the fairgrounds must pass through the security checkpoint.

cards.name: Cultivator's Caravan
cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Deadlock Trap
cards.text:
Deadlock Trap enters the battlefield tapped.
When Deadlock Trap enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}: Tap target creature or planeswalker. Its activated abilities can't be activated this turn.

cards.name: Decoction Module
cards.text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{4}, {T}: Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Progress leads to inspiration.

cards.name: Demolition Stomper
cards.text:
Demolition Stomper can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
Crew 5 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 5 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Dukhara Peafowl
cards.text: {U}: Dukhara Peafowl gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Elegant filigree birds perch along the eleven bridges that cross Canal Dukhara.

cards.name: Dynavolt Tower
cards.text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}: Dynavolt Tower deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"I like that Tezzeret. He has vision the other judges don't. He sees the potential in what we're making here."
-Faiz, inventor

cards.name: Eager Construct
cards.text: When Eager Construct enters the battlefield, each player may scry 1. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.flavor: Loyal to a fault, it anticipates its master's every need.

cards.name: Electrostatic Pummeler
cards.text:
When Electrostatic Pummeler enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}: Electrostatic Pummeler gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.

cards.name: Fabrication Module
cards.text:
Whenever you get one or more {E} (energy counters), put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
{4}, {T}: You get {E}.
cards.flavor: Inspiration leads to design.

cards.name: Filigree Familiar
cards.text:
When Filigree Familiar enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
When Filigree Familiar dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"It's the must-have gift for everyone on your list. Get one for yourself, too!"
-Chammi, curio vendor

cards.name: Fireforger's Puzzleknot
cards.text:
When Fireforger's Puzzleknot enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.
{2}{R}, Sacrifice Fireforger's Puzzleknot: It deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Fleetwheel Cruiser
cards.text:
Trample, haste
When Fleetwheel Cruiser enters the battlefield, it becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.
Crew 2 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 2 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Foundry Inspector
cards.text: Artifact spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: Automaton inspectors ensure that the Consulate's stringent standards for mass production are upheld.

cards.name: Ghirapur Orrery
cards.text:
Each player may play an additional land on each of their turns.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player has no cards in hand, that player draws three cards.
cards.flavor: This detailed model allows the edificers to examine the city from every angle.

cards.name: Glassblower's Puzzleknot
cards.text:
When Glassblower's Puzzleknot enters the battlefield, scry 2, then you get {E}{E}. (You get two energy counters. To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
{2}{U}, Sacrifice Glassblower's Puzzleknot: Scry 2, then you get {E}{E}.

foreignPrintings.name: ガラス吹き工の組細工

cards.name: Inventor's Goggles
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+2.
Whenever an Artificer enters the battlefield under your control, you may attach Inventor's Goggles to it.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Iron League Steed
cards.text:
Haste
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)
cards.flavor: The Iron League prides itself on its metal-shaping techniques.

foreignPrintings.name: Corcel de la Liga de Hierro
Destrier de la Ligue de fer

cards.name: Key to the City
cards.text:
{T}, Discard a card: Up to one target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Whenever Key to the City becomes untapped, you may pay {2}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: It would be unfortunate if the key fell into the wrong hands.

cards.name: Metalspinner's Puzzleknot
cards.text:
When Metalspinner's Puzzleknot enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
{2}{B}, Sacrifice Metalspinner's Puzzleknot: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Metalwork Colossus
cards.text:
This spell costs {X} less to cast, where X is the total mana value of noncreature artifacts you control.
Sacrifice two artifacts: Return Metalwork Colossus from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Multiform Wonder
cards.text:
When Multiform Wonder enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
Pay {E}: Multiform Wonder gains your choice of flying, vigilance, or lifelink until end of turn.
Pay {E}: Multiform Wonder gets +2/-2 or -2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Narnam Cobra
cards.text: {G}: Narnam Cobra gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Some say tales of the Narnam greenhouse are told to scare the children, but every tale grows from a seed of truth.

cards.name: Ovalchase Dragster
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: It'll either crash or win the race. Possibly both.

cards.name: Panharmonicon
cards.text: If an artifact or creature entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.
cards.flavor: All who listen hear their own song, a unique melody played just for them.

cards.name: Perpetual Timepiece
cards.text:
{T}: Mill two cards.
{2}, Exile Perpetual Timepiece: Shuffle any number of target cards from your graveyard into your library.
cards.flavor: Do not be so caught up in keeping track of time that you forget to make use of it.

cards.name: Prakhata Pillar-Bug
cards.text: {B}: Prakhata Pillar-Bug gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: Not a mote of dust escapes the dutiful cleaners that keep the exclusive Prakhata Club immaculate.

cards.name: Prophetic Prism
cards.text:
When Prophetic Prism enters the battlefield, draw a card.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: To understand Kaladesh, one must first understand how aether and invention flow together through the great Aether Cycle.

cards.name: Renegade Freighter
cards.text:
Whenever Renegade Freighter attacks, it gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
Crew 2 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 2 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Scrapheap Scrounger
cards.text:
Scrapheap Scrounger can't block.
{1}{B}, Exile another creature card from your graveyard: Return Scrapheap Scrounger from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Some machines refuse to accept their own obsolescence.

cards.name: Self-Assembler
cards.text: When Self-Assembler enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Assembly-Worker creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor: It sees itself in all of its creations.

cards.name: Sky Skiff
cards.text:
Flying
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Skysovereign, Consul Flagship
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Skysovereign, Consul Flagship enters the battlefield or attacks, it deals 3 damage to target creature or planeswalker an opponent controls.
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

foreignPrintings.name: Souverain des cieux, navire amiral du consul
領事の旗艦、スカイソブリン

cards.name: Smuggler's Copter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Smuggler's Copter attacks or blocks, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Snare Thopter
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor:
"I did not think I would understand the cold filigree creatures of this world, but they too are governed by the laws of nature."
-Nissa Revane

cards.name: Torch Gauntlet
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor:
"Good morning, children. Please open your aether valves and ignite your gauntlets."
-Rakib, Ghirapur schoolteacher

cards.name: Weldfast Monitor
cards.text: {R}: Weldfast Monitor gains menace until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The avant-garde among Ghirapur's inventors disregard the Consulate's safety standards completely.

cards.name: Whirlermaker
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Our creations are more than mere things. They have life in them, little bits of ourselves."
-Saheeli Rai

cards.name: Woodweaver's Puzzleknot
cards.text:
When Woodweaver's Puzzleknot enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life and get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
{2}{G}, Sacrifice Woodweaver's Puzzleknot: You gain 3 life and get {E}{E}{E}.

cards.name: Workshop Assistant
cards.text: When Workshop Assistant dies, return another target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Sometimes the smallest things make the biggest difference.

cards.name: Aether Hub
cards.text:
When Aether Hub enters the battlefield, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Pay {E}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: It powers the dreams of Ghirapur.

cards.name: Blooming Marsh
cards.text:
Blooming Marsh enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or fewer other lands.
{T}: Add {B} or {G}.
cards.flavor: A retreat to nature can inspire even the most jaded inventor.

cards.name: Botanical Sanctum
cards.text:
Botanical Sanctum enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or fewer other lands.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.
cards.flavor: Life inspires technology, which expands life's domain.

cards.name: Concealed Courtyard
cards.text:
Concealed Courtyard enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or fewer other lands.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.
cards.flavor: Where high society and dark opportunity intersect.

cards.name: Inspiring Vantage
cards.text:
Inspiring Vantage enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or fewer other lands.
{T}: Add {R} or {W}.
cards.flavor: Ghirapur is a beacon of inspiration, attracting the most brilliant minds on Kaladesh.

cards.name: Inventors' Fair
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control three or more artifacts, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {C}.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Inventors' Fair: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Activate only if you control three or more artifacts.

cards.name: Sequestered Stash
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Sequestered Stash: Mill five cards. Then you may put an artifact card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Spirebluff Canal
cards.text:
Spirebluff Canal enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or fewer other lands.
{T}: Add {U} or {R}.
cards.flavor: There's so much more to Ghirapur than can be accessed by traditional roads.

cards.name: Chandra, Pyrogenius
cards.text:
[+2]: Chandra, Pyrogenius deals 2 damage to each opponent.
[−3]: Chandra, Pyrogenius deals 4 damage to target creature.
[−10]: Chandra, Pyrogenius deals 6 damage to target player or planeswalker and each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.

foreignPrintings.name: 紅蓮の俊英、チャンドラ

cards.name: Flame Lash
cards.text: Flame Lash deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "This is just my warm-up."

cards.name: Liberating Combustion
cards.text: Liberating Combustion deals 6 damage to target creature. You may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Chandra, Pyrogenius, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle.

cards.name: Renegade Firebrand
cards.text: As long as you control a Chandra planeswalker, Renegade Firebrand gets +1/+0 and has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: "For freedom! For fame! For fire!"

cards.name: Stone Quarry
cards.text:
Stone Quarry enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {W}.
cards.flavor: The Inventors' Renaissance came on the heels of the Great Aether Boom, hiking demand for raw materials of every kind.

cards.name: Nissa, Nature's Artisan
cards.text:
[+3]: You gain 3 life.
[−4]: Reveal the top two cards of your library. Put all land cards from among them onto the battlefield and the rest into your hand.
[−12]: Creatures you control get +5/+5 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Guardian of the Great Conduit
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
As long as you control a Nissa planeswalker, Guardian of the Great Conduit gets +2/+0 and has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)

cards.name: Terrain Elemental
cards.flavor:
"You tread upon the land all the time, yet you seem dismayed when it moves to step on you."
-Nissa Revane

cards.name: Verdant Crescendo
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Search your library and graveyard for a card named Nissa, Nature's Artisan, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Woodland Stream
cards.text:
Woodland Stream enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.
cards.flavor: Waterways carve their routes through the land to reflect the paths the aether streams cut through the clouds.
